item.title: Setting Up a Git Repository for Pushing to GitHub
item.description: This post provides a step-by-step guide for setting up a new Git repository with main as the initial branch and linking it to a GitHub repository without relying on the default origin label. It includes details on staging and committing files, pushing to a custom remote, and handling authentication with GitHubâ€™s Personal Access Token (PAT) system. This streamlined approach helps ensure secure and efficient repository management on GitHub, making it easier to use common Git commands (push and pull) without needing to specify a remote every time.
